Real-time data via webhook APIs

Nearly all digital products have one thing in common, they manage data. In 95% of the cases, they will have a REST API to provide for multiple UXs for their customers and to give their customers the ability to create their own UX.

However, in comparison very few digital products today have the capability to provide real-time access to their product's data.

Is it important to provide Real-Time data? Yes!

The majority of products don’t work in a silo, often they are integrated into a bigger ecosystem. A functioning organization that requires data to be synchronized and processes to be automated.

The best and most efficient way to synchronize data and automate processes is with Real-Time Data.

It’s best because it provides customers with a better UX across their organization, not just in your product.

It also scales and is the most efficient use of resources (in comparison to polling REST APIs for example).

Accesible, efficent & scalable way to get Real-Time Data

Webhook APIs enables an organization to be fast and agile when it comes to process automation and data synchronization, distributing integration efforts to their agile teams (instead of centralizing integration within a specific integration team).

Move away from centralized integration teams!

However, developing your own webhook API solution takes many more engineering hours than the average REST API.

Especially if you take into consideration all the functionality (security, subscription management, discoverability, incident recovery, etc) that a webhook API solution requires to meet enterprise integration needs.

That is the problem that webhookie addresses.

An open-source, powerful, and flexible webhook API platform that you can add to your product, platform, or integration architecture in minutes.

Accesible, efficent & scalable way to get Real-Time Data

Webhook APIs enables an organization to be fast and agile when it comes to process automation and data synchronization, distributing integration efforts to their agile teams (instead of centralizing integration within a specific integration team).

Move away from centralized integration teams!

However, developing your own webhook API solution takes many more engineering hours than the average REST API.

Especially if you take into consideration all the functionality (security, subscription management, discoverability, incident recovery, etc) that a webhook API solution requires to meet enterprise integration needs.

That is the problem that webhookie addresses.

An open-source, powerful, and flexible webhook API platform that you can add to your product, platform, or integration architecture in minutes.

So how does it works?

1

Deploy webhookie into your cloud architecture.

Add webhookie to your architecture, it’s easily deployable to any infrastructure via a container using docker or helm.

LEARN MORE ->

3

Start sending events to webhookie using our REST API or AMQP

Remember events can be anything happening in your system, from new records being created, updated, or deleted - to state changes and process events. If you only want a specific event to be sent/available to a specific partner this can be specified using the authorized subscriber concept.

LEARN MORE ->

2

Design your webhook APIs

Design your webhook APIs using our design tool and the ASYNC API specification. This step is optional but highly recommended. With an API specification, you can communicate your API requirements to your API consumers so that they can easily discover your API requirements and get started faster with more confidence.

LEARN MORE ->

4

Allow subscriptions

Allow your API consumers to subscribe to the topics within your webhook API that they are interested in. They manage their own subscription so that your team isn’t slowed down with integration requests.

LEARN MORE ->

Allow subscriptions

Allow your API consumers to subscribe to the topics within your webhook API that they are interested in. They manage their own subscription so that your team isn’t slowed down with integration requests.

LEARN MORE ->

And that's it, you are providing real-time access to your data to authorized API consumers.
